title: Rename autograd namespace to torch and change torch.h into python.h
body_html:
This PR does three things:

  1. Changes autograd namespace (still from autogradpp) to torch
  2. Renames torch/autograd.h to torch/torch.h
  3. Because this now collides with the torch/torch.h we have for the C++ extensions API, I have moved torch/torch.h into torch/csrc/api/include/python.h and moved torch/csrc/torch.cpp to torch/csrc/api/src/python.cpp. This changes the include for C++ extensions from torch/torch.h to torch/python.h, which is an active API breakage. I do this because eventually the C++ extensions API will just be the C++ API + Python binding stuff. I name it torch/python.h instead of torch/extension.h because we may well get other language bindings in the future.

Testing on internal projects now.

CC @ebetica @apaszke @fmassa
body_text:
This PR does three things:

Changes autograd namespace (still from autogradpp) to torch
Renames torch/autograd.h to torch/torch.h
Because this now collides with the torch/torch.h we have for the C++ extensions API, I have moved torch/torch.h into torch/csrc/api/include/python.h and moved torch/csrc/torch.cpp to torch/csrc/api/src/python.cpp. This changes the include for C++ extensions from torch/torch.h to torch/python.h, which is an active API breakage. I do this because eventually the C++ extensions API will just be the C++ API + Python binding stuff. I name it torch/python.h instead of torch/extension.h because we may well get other language bindings in the future.

Testing on internal projects now.
CC @ebetica @apaszke @fmassa
body:
This PR does three things:

1. Changes `autograd` namespace (still from autogradpp) to `torch`
2. Renames `torch/autograd.h` to `torch/torch.h`
3. Because this now collides with the `torch/torch.h` we have for the C++ extensions API, I have moved `torch/torch.h` into `torch/csrc/api/include/python.h` and moved `torch/csrc/torch.cpp` to `torch/csrc/api/src/python.cpp`. This changes the include for C++ extensions from `torch/torch.h` to `torch/python.h`, which is an active API breakage. I do this because eventually the C++ extensions API will just be the C++ API + Python binding stuff. I name it `torch/python.h` instead of `torch/extension.h` because we may well get other language bindings in the future.

Testing on internal projects now.

CC @ebetica @apaszke @fmassa
